comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: KA-3B Skywarrior Bu No 142661 Tail code TR of VAQ-35 ‘Black Ravens’ Modex 616. Black bird like marking across rudder and center tail. Black painted DECM fairing on rear end of fuselage. (Defensive Electronic Countermeasures) Former EKA-3B converted back to KA-3B from teardrop tell tale marks of ECM fairings on fore and aft fuselage sides. Squadron insignia behid cockpit, diagonal azure blue line on fuselage and similar color on fin top. Remaining ECM aerial dome on extreme fin. High angle sunlight over blue ocean. Fluffy cumulus clouds. Notes on KA-3B 142661 Built as A3D-2 Accepted by US Navy April 1959 Converted to KA-3B by NARF Alameda June 1967 Further converted to EKA-3B Dec. 1967 To desert storage at the then MASDC as AN2A0094 Feb 14, 1974 Scrapped at MASDC Two early pictures of A-3B 142661 equipped as an aerial tanker: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A-3B_VAH-5_refueling_Scim... Douglas A3D-2 Skywarrior BuNo 142661 VAH-5, CVG-8, CVA-59 USS Forrestal (refueling Royal Navy Supermarine Scimitar F.1 (s/n XD244), 803 Naval Air Squadron, HMS Hermes (R12). Accompanied by Vought F8U-1P Crusader Bu No 146895 VFP-62 Det. 59 Fighting Photos. 1962-1963 commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A-3B_VAH-5_refueling_Scim... Douglas A3D-2 Skywarrior BuNo 142661. VAH-5, CVG-8, CVA-59 USS Forrestal refueling Royal Navy Supermarine Scimitar F.1 (s/n XD327) 803 Naval Air Squadron, HMS Hermes (R12) Accompanied by Douglas A4D-2N Skyhawk BuNo 147801, VA-83 'Rampagers'. 1962-1963 A-3B Skywarriors were able to act as tankers before official 1967 designation for their role and the conversion of remainder of the fleet to aerial refuelers. A short time after March 8 or 9 1967 when two other KA-3B were lost in combat, KA-3B 142661 joined VAH-4 DET.C (code ZB), becoming Modex 5 as a replacement. This was aboard CVA-63 USS KITTY HAWK during its Vietnam War deployment to the Tonkin Gulf lasting from Nov.5, 1966 to June 20, 1967 www.gonavy.jp/CVW11-NH1966.html VAH-4 DET. C was part of CVW-11. (info courtesy of ‘GO!NAVY’ and Takafumi Hiroe of Japan) 1970 picture of EKA-3B 142661: geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/A/A-3/EKA-3B/EKA-3B.htm EKA-3B 142661 VAQ-130 DET-31. Modex 615. Tail code NF. 1970.08.12/ATSUGI 12 Aug 1973 over NAF Atsugi, Japan. 1974 picture of EKA-3B 142661 as marked in 'flickr' pic: a3skywarriorforwhidbey.org/142661_EKA-3B_VAQ-135_NP616_13... EKA-3B 142661. VAQ-135 Modex 616. Tail code NP. (Picture may have been dated 13 Oct 1974)
